info.name: Accessory nerve
info.description: The accessory or eleventh cranial nerve originates from the (spinal) accessory nucleus located in the lateral aspect of the anterior horn of cervical spinal cord segments C1 to C5. The nerve roots emerge from the lateral aspect of the spinal cord, just dorsal to the denticulate ligament. The roots then turn rostrally, enter the cranium through the foramen magnum. The accessory nerve innervates the sternocleidomastoid and trapezius muscles.
